name: Lion Pub
description: The Lion Pub has the best entrance of any bar in Colombo and really cheap beer and good food in large portions
reviews:
The Lion Pub is one of a Mount Lavinia's oldest food establishments, and
 has since become somewhat of a landmark. It may not be as popular as it
 was back in the day, but the food is surprisingly good, the portions 
are generous and the atmosphere is perfect for a cool Lion lager.
The
 Lion Pub serves up some happiness inducing Sri Lankan Chinese fare. The
 prices are also incredibly cheap for the massive portions they serve 
up. We'd suggest going with a group of around four because even the 
small portions are way too much for two. You can easily manage for 
around Rs. 700 per head with beer. The food is mostly Sri Lankan 
Chinese, but this is actually one of the few oldies that still does it 
really well.
You can't go a to a place named the Lion Pub 
and not have a Lion lager (Rs. 250). They've got a pretty comprehensive beverage menu, all of it priced as low as you'll probably 
find.
For rice, we went with their simplest option- the 
egg and onion fried rice (Rs. 570 for S). We actually really liked this 
one since it didn't have too many veges, instead you get a good amount 
of onion for added texture. The rice isn't basmati but still worked very
 well with the rest of the dishes we ordered.
The double fried 
pork (Rs. 570 for S) was a solid iteration of the classic devilled pork.
 I'm a huge fan of fatty pork, so this one was right up my alley. The 
good thing, however, is the fact that there was a great balance of heat,
 pepper and seasoning though it does come with quite a lot of onions and
 green chillies.
The hot butter cuttlefish (Rs. 590 for S) was
 also decent but not one of the best we've had. The cuttlefish was 
actually cooked fine, but the batter was just a bit too thick. That 
being said, it works well as a bite to have along with a beer.
The
 best dish we tried though, was the Singapore chilli crab (560 for S). 
We looked at the price and assumed it would be a small portion, but what
 we got was easily enough for four and then some. It also tasted really 
great with just the right amount of sweetness and chilli in the almost 
glaze like sauce, with the crab being cooked to the point where you 
could crush the shell and easily get all the meat.
As
 far as iconic entrances go, you'd be hard-pressed to find one that can 
rival that of the Lion Pub with their lion head.  The interior
 is very simple with wooden furniture and white walls. They've also got 
an outdoor seating area under the shade of a very large bamboo tree.
You'll likely find a few old gents having a few cold ones and catching 
up on some cricket.
Service at the Lion Pub 
was actually ridiculously fast. The waiters have this really nonchalant 
attitude but their actually very efficient.
The Lion Pub is a classic, and a good one at that. If you're looking for a place to meet up with some friends, grab some beers and bites to eat, the Lion Pub fits the bill perfectly.
The Lion Pub is one of a Mount Lavinia's oldest food establishments, and has since become somewhat of a landmark. It may not be as popular as it was back in the day, but the food is surprisingly good, the portions are generous and the atmosphere is perfect for a cool Lion lager.
The Lion Pub has the best entrance of any bar in Colombo and really cheap beer and bites. The only catch is that the service is pretty bad.

කොහොම කොහොම හරි අන්තිම බියර් ටවර් එක වාශ්ප වෙනව මම දන්නෙත් නෑ. වැදුනා කිව්වට ඒ හැටි වැදිලත් නෑ. ඒකට බලන්න එපැයි බඩ, හොඳට පිරිලා. අනේ මන්දා ඉතින්…

කෑම ගැන විතරක් නෙවෙයි බීම ගැනත් අපේ කට්ටිය නිතරම හොයන නිසා ලංකාවෙ කොහේ තිබුණත් හොඳ අවන්හල් නම් හංගන්න ටිකක් අමාරුයි.

කොළඹ බාර් අතරින් හොඳම ඇතුල්වීමේ දොරටුව තිබෙන්නේ ලයන් පබ් එකේ. ඒ වගේ ම එහි ඇත්තෙන් ම මිළ අඩු බීර හා බයිට් වර්ග තිබෙනවා. එක ම ප්‍රශ්නය සේවාව දුර්වල වීමයි.
